properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 13 at 3:43AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Rip Currents along with a Long Shore Current will be
present in the surf zone today.

* WHERE...Southern Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, Martin,
Coastal Volusia and Northern Brevard Counties.

* WHEN...From 7 AM EST this morning through this evening.

* IMPACTS...Rough surf and strong currents flowing parallel to the
beach can knock you down, and make you more susceptible to
being caught in the seaward pull of a Rip Current..
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FOR RIP CURRENTS FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING
